alert.note: Alert for Swift (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 14 at 4:22PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN SWIFT COUNTY THROUGH 445 PM CDT... At 422 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lake Oliver, or 18 miles east of Ortonville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Benson, Lake Oliver, Artichoke Lake, Clontarf, Danvers, and Benson Airport. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 12 between mile markers 17 and 46. U.S. Highway 59 between mile markers 143 and 153. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
